faqs.response: Yellow leaves in paddy often indicate nitrogen deficiency. Apply urea fertilizer (50-60 kg per acre) and ensure proper water management.
For pest control, use neem oil spray or contact your local agricultural officer for specific pesticide recommendations.
Maintain 2-3 cm standing water in paddy fields. During water scarcity, use alternate wetting and drying method.
For balanced nutrition, use NPK fertilizer in 3 splits: 25% at transplanting, 50% at tillering, 25% at flowering stage.
Apply fungicide spray and ensure proper field drainage. Remove infected plants immediately to prevent spread.
